_exec_summary.SummaryText: SACHEM, Inc. is a specialty chemical manufacturer located in Cleburne's Industrial Park.  We provide high purity chemicals and services worldwide to electronics, catalysts, and pharmaceutical markets and to most major chemical manufacturers.  The company was started in Austin in 1950, expanded to the current bulk production facility at Cleburne in 1990, a facility in Wuxi, China and acquired a facility in Zaltbommel, Netherlands.  SACHEMs Mission Statement and SACHEM Americas' Integrated Management System policy is the framework for our commitment to continual improvement in all our activities, including Quality, Responsible Care(EHS&S), Sustainability, and Ethical performance. We commit to comply, at a minimum, with all applicable laws and regulations in the communities, states, and countries in which we operate, as well as other obligations we accept. Continual improvement of the effectiveness and performance of our Management System and the prevention of pollution are driven by our Corporate Mission and the SACHEM Way. We will share our efforts and our performance with stakeholders/interested parties, and consider their input, as appropriate. By committing ourselves to the Responsible Care Guiding Principles we acknowledge the privilege we have been given to operate in the Austin and Cleburne communities. We also commit to protect our property and associates, and to continuously improve our product stewardship.  This speaks to Safety, Health and Environmental stewardship being a precondition to anything that we do.  All associates operate under that philosophy.  We work hard every single day to be a safe, environmentally friendly neighbor and we are involved in many voluntary programs at the local, state and federal level.  We are proactive in various civic activities in Cleburne and are active members of the Johnson County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).  The President of SACHEM has said many times "There is not one pound of chemical worth making tha

t jeopardizes safety, health, and the environment". 

    SACHEM, Inc. is an ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 14001:2015 certified facility and is committed to continuous improvement in all aspects of its production processes.  We are members the ACC (American Chemical Council).  As members of ACC, SACHEM has implemented the Responsible Care Codes of Management Practices and Guiding Principles.  Some of the key Guiding Principles are:  1.) To recognize and respond to community concerns about chemicals and our operations, 2.) To make health, safety, security and environmental considerations a priority in our planning for all existing and new products and processes, and 3.) To operate our plants and facilities in a manner that protects the environment and the health and safety of our employees and the public. 

    Process Safety Management (PSM) is also part of SACHEM's daily operating philosophy.  PSM includes the following components: process safety information, process hazard analysis, operating procedures, training, contractors, pre-startup safety reviews, mechanical integrity, hot work permits, management of change, incident investigation, emergency planning and response, compliance audits, and trade secrets.  The hazards of the chemicals are found in the Safety Data Sheets (SDS), which SACHEM retains, for each chemical it has on site.  



     Operator training is a major undertaking at SACHEM.  Before a new operator is allowed to operate a process, he goes through extensive training. There are operating associates on-site 24 hours a day, 365 days a year ensuring that the plant is operating in a safe manner.  Daily leak checks and inspections are performed on all process piping, reaction vessels and storage tanks.  All process equipment and storage vessels have safety controls, including warning alarms, automatic shutoff devices and relief valves and continuous computer monitoring to prevent problems.  There are yearly integrity inspections on vessels, piping and electrical eq

uipment which includes storage vessel thickness inspections.  The pressure relief valves from storage vessels and process equipment are sent to the manufacturer for yearly inspection and testing.  SACHEM has participated in the voluntary OSHCON program for the last 25 years. 



     As previously mentioned, SACHEM manufactures specialty chemicals and the chemicals that are on site above threshold quantities are methyl chloride, trimethylamine, ethyl chloride and formaldehyde. Methyl chloride and formaldehyde are on the toxic list, while trimethylamine and ethyl chloride are on the flammable list.  Methyl chloride and trimethylamine worst case scenarios impact off-site receptors using the OCA Guidance Document and RMP Comp.  There are written operating procedures with high level alarms that prevent more than 80% of the designed capacity to be stored in these tanks.  Both formaldehyde and ethyl chloride were evaluated, but methyl chloride and trimethylamine resulted in the worst case scenario with the farthest impact to offsite receptors.

For the alternative release scenario (ARS), the storage tank was assumed to overpressure causing the pressure relief valve to vent the excess pressure.  The ARS for trimethylamine and methyl chloride impacted off-site receptors using the OCA Guidance Document and RMP Comp.  Trimethylamine and methyl chloride are liquefied compressed gasses and kept under pressure for storage at ambient temperature.  The pressure relief valves are installed to prevent the worst case scenario.  They are designed to relieve the pressure prior to tank failure. The alternative release scenario (ARS) for the other toxic onsite, formaldehyde is the release from puncture and release of the entire contents of our largest container (330 gallon tote).  This would be the most likely scenario to occur.  Assuming a tote was punctured and the entire contents (2900 pounds) were released.  Distance to off-site receptors was determined using the OCA Guidance Documen

t and RMP Comp.  To prevent such accidents only one tote is handled at a time and associates are trained to handle and store chemicals with care. Other systems in place to manage the risk include daily visual inspection of the storage tanks, daily raw material inventory, contractor safety training, preventive maintenance program, and incident investigations on all near misses.

The five-year accident history shows that there have been no RMP reportable accidents in the 30 years SACHEM has been in Cleburne.  This means there have been no on-site deaths, injuries, or property damage and no off-site deaths, hospitalizations, medical treatment, evacuation, sheltering-in-place, property damage and environmental damage, which includes fish or animal kills, tree, lawn, shrub, or crop damage, water contamination, or soil contamination.

SACHEM's Emergency Response Program was developed with input from the Cleburne Fire Department, local LEPC, and Cleburne Emergency Management officials.  If an emergency occurs, a plant wide alarm is sounded with instructions given over the intercom system.  The emergency phone number, 911, is called to inform the City of Cleburne of our needs and the type of emergency present.  If an evacuation is necessary, all associates, including contractors are gathered and roll call is taken to ensure everyone that was in the plant made it safely to the rally point.  The incident command system takes over from there.  In using this system, all the emergency groups are communicating effectively. The emergency is assessed and additional response equipment and associates are called, if required.  SACHEM has 15 associates that are HAZWOPER, Hazardous Waste and Emergency Response, trained that are available to attend to most spills.  We have a 24-hour emergency responder contracted to help us in an emergency, if needed.  The Cleburne Police Department will assist SACHEM if evacuation or sheltering in place is required.  We test the emergency alarm system w

eekly and have quarterly drills. At least annually, we have a joint drill with Cleburne Emergency Departments and our 24-hour emergency responder to ensure that SACHEM's Emergency Response Program is kept up to date.  The HAZWOPER trained associates also go through annual refresher training.

SACHEM believes strongly about its continuous improvement of all processes and equipment.  Before a new process is added, a Process Hazardous Review and Pre-Start Up Review are completed to ensure that all aspects of safety, health and the environment are considered. As mentioned previously, all associates of SACHEM work hard every single day to be a safe, environmentally friendly neighbor and the associates consider it a privilege to operate in Cleburne.  SACHEM will not make one pound of chemical that jeopardizes safety, health and environmental concerns, both on and off site.

SACHEM refers to its Mission in all it does and plans to do. We will all face "moments of truth" where our Mission is perhaps challenged and we must not accept or tolerate trade-offs in our delivery of the Mission. Each moment that we step up and support the Mission strengthens us and each moment we do not weakens us. 

In support of the values stated in our Mission, SACHEM operates in a manner that is firm in some core areas and flexible in areas that invite individual and joint creativity. We call this the SACHEM Way. 

SACHEM has a workplace that supports our associates' needs in an environment that is respectful and professional in delivery, while also cordial and fun working environment. SACHEM uses fact-based judgment to prioritize what needs to be done to protect, enhance, and expand the business. These needs are delivered with a relentless, urgent discipline of execution. We have a flexible organization - both departmental and team-based organizational models are normal at SACHEM. We invite ideas and encourage continuous improvement and innovation. 

We support the success of all our associates

that we serve - our customers, personnel, communities, governments, suppliers, and shareholders. Simply stated, this can be done when we understand that:

?    HSSEE: Health, safety, security, health, environment, quality, sustainability, and ethical performance are a precondition to anything we do.

?    Customer Focus: Customers are the primary source of our success, so it is important that we give unrelenting attention to the delivery of outcomes that create greater value for the customer.

?    Providing Support: Supporting another associate's success ultimately builds our individual and joint success. 

?    Accountability: We strive for personal accountability in our roles by constantly clarifying our priorities and understanding the results expected of us. We must exercise the authority granted us responsibly and assume ownership for our decisions, always striving for achievement beyond just what is expected.

?    Collaborative Performance Culture: Our personnel and other associates possess invaluable knowledge which should be able to be shared easily across the organizational network by reaching out.  

?    Financial Performance: SACHEM's financial strength is the foundation of our individual and joint success, so each of us must act as financial stewards for the company. 



We operate under the clear understanding that for every "right" an associate has, there is a corresponding "responsibility". For example, our customers have the right to expect stellar service and quality product, and they have the responsibility to pay as agreed. This applies to all associates, internal and external. Some other critical corresponding relationships at SACHEM include: 

?    SACHEM personnel will share both in the success and challenges of the company, deserving market competitive pay, and a safe working environment. Correspondingly, we must deliver productive work, be fiscally responsible, support the Mission, and work safely.

?    SACHEM personnel should provide input, suggestions, concer

ns, and ideas as the business develops directions and makes decisions. We provide systems and business processes to encourage such an environment. Decision-makers should welcome input and be collaborative, focusing only on making the best decision. Once a decision is properly made at SACHEM, it is critical that we pull together and work to make it happen. 

?    SACHEM strives to share information, technology, proprietary know-how, and other knowledge pieces that help associates do their job. However, we must diligently and unwaveringly assure that any proprietary information not be divulged outside SACHEM unless it is protected and beneficial to SACHEM. 

?    SACHEM provides systems and framework systems of operation (ISO 9001:2015, ISO 14001:2015, REACH, Responsible Care, Associate Handbooks, Learning and Development Programs, etc.) to bring clarity to certain important aspects of our business. We need to understand them and support and implement their directives. 







         Our business efforts must concentrate on those areas that allow us to be the only, the best and the most reliable company providing our products and services. Certainly, we will have standard products and services, but those that are "the only, the best, and the most reliable" make us unique, special, and invaluable to our customers. We must always protect our base of existing business while expanding with new products, services, markets, geographies, applications, and so on. As we protect our base business and expand, we must apply discipline and innovation in anticipation of what the future will bring. 



The SACHEM Way is unique because we are the sum of many pieces - our personnel, our customers, suppliers, communities, shareholders, and governments.
